qas.question: How long was a typical workday for Nasser?
What illness was Nasser diagnosed with in 1960?
What did Egyptian state media claim was the reason for Nasser's absence after his second heart attack?

context: Nasser had few personal vices other than <a0_0>chain smoking<a0_0/>. He maintained <a1_0>18-hour<a1_0/> workdays and rarely took time off for vacations. The combination of smoking and working long hours contributed to his poor health. He was diagnosed with <a2_0>diabetes<a2_0/> in the early 1960s and by the time of his death in <a3_0>1970<a3_0/>, he also had arteriosclerosis, heart disease, and high blood pressure. He suffered two major heart attacks (in 1966 and 1969), and was on bed rest for six weeks after the second episode. State media reported that Nasser's absence from the public view at that time was a result of <a4_0>influenza<a4_0/>.
